instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..
definitions.USBC_XA_CC2: What is USBC_XA_CC2? USBC_XA_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.USBC_XB_CC1: What is USBC_XB_CC1? USBC_XB_CC1 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.USBC_XB_CC2: What is USBC_XB_CC2? USBC_XB_CC2 is a line between the USB-C muxing chip such as the CD3217 or CD3215 and the USB-C charger. Communication must happen on this line in order for the USB-C charger to put out 20v..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
this device got liquid damaged,  shorted <SIGNAL>PPVIN_P3V3HRTC_R</SIGNAL>, replacing <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> relieve the short.
both port is 5v loop but mac turn on withbattery.

but usb c cannot be used to charge or detect usb drive.
i notice, if battery is connected. one port will have 5v 0amp, while the other port wont even turn on the ahm meter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
i have replaced both cd, one by one and test the symptom, but still same.
i have ruled out charging port aswell.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
Your problem should be on USB-C area, if machine works with battery connected.
Compare diode mode readings between both ports; especially CC1/2 lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
i have measured this earlier.
dz3302 seems chipped, so just for testing, i remove it.
but diode mode at <SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL> and cc2 is already the same, at 0.531.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
i compare the diode mode reading between port fpc, both port measure the same ( i compare the counterpart of the same line ).
i notice a chipped dz3302. but the line itself isnt shorted.
any chance its from <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
On the port where USB meter stays black, should be a problem with CC1/2 lines.
These lines are used for hardware detection of charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
when i test again, the top port that correspond to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> doesnt respond to ahmeter, even without battery.
the bottom port still loop.
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> 0.93
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC1</SIGNAL> 0.498
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC2</SIGNAL> 0.496
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC2</SIGNAL> 0.530
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL> 0.530

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
Check the input fuses and compare diode mode readings around input MOSFETs too.
Also check continuity from <SIGNAL>XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> USB-C terminal and corresponding fuse.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> got continuity to both <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> fuse.
about <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL>, i dont see any fuse there.
but it does have continuity from the port to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP> and its nearby component

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
Hmm, on this model the fuses are placed after <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chips; not a real input protection.

You should find something wrong on the port corresponding to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>.
Maybe the chip is bad...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
yeah, im ordering new chip to make sure, im not sure mines known good..
will update after replacing both chip again, thanks for the guidance!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
both <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> has been replaced with new one, but still exact symtomps..
to sum up, macbook still alive with battery.
without battery, top port doesnt respond to magsafe at all.
bottom port is 5v from 0-0.26amp then loop..
any pointeR ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
5V from charger is enabled by CC1/2 pins configuration.
Check all components related.
Compare readings between both ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> diode mode is 0.140
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XA_VBUS</SIGNAL> 0.140
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC1</SIGNAL> 0.580
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC</SIGNAL> 0.585
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_CC2</SIGNAL> 0.580
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_CC2</SIGNAL> 0.586
doesnt see any component on these cc line, its directly connected to <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> which i have replaced..
continuity is good at every probe point to another.. any pointer where to go next ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v loop without battery, but turn on with battery.
threads.message: Probably broken trace from USB-C terminals; on the port where ampmeter stays black.
